page.title: 18Himbleton C.E. School
page.content: Himbleton C.E. First School is set in a small village and is the provided school for a number of hamlets. Few modern houses have been built and the village retains its rural quality. The school was built by the church in 1873. The original building is still in use but has been modified over the years. A temporary classroom has been added on a site adjacent to the main building. Provision is made for between 40 and 50 pupils and the school is generally well-attended. Although the school was originally intended for children of agricultural workers, today these pupils are in a minority, since a large proportion of to-day's villagers work outside the area. Parents are supportive and show keen interest in their childrens' work
